name: NSAccessibilityLayoutArea
desc: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a layout area.

items.name: func accessibilityChildren() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the accessibility element’s children in the accessibility hierarchy.

items.name: var accessibilityFocusedUIElement: Any
items.desc: The child accessibility element with the current focus.

items.name: func accessibilityLabel() -> String
items.desc: Returns a short description of the layout area.

items.name: func accessibilitySelectedChildren() -> [Any]?
items.desc: Returns the layout area’s currently selected children.
